A little bit
ABOUT ME

Experienced psychologist transitioned into an emerging Front-end developer.
I hold a Master's Degree in Psychology and have gained diverse experiences in the field of disabilities, with a particular emphasis on ensuring that everyday actions, often overlooked, are accessible to all individuals.

Self-taught in HTML, CSS, and Javascript through platforms like Udemy and O'Reilly, I completed the React Development and Responsive Web Development course at SheCodes, solidifying my proficiency in Front-end Development.

My background and current immersion in the coding world synergize harmoniously, as my skills in understanding user needs, particularly in implementing tailored accessibility solutions, effortlessly transition into the Web Development where Iâ€™d like to navigate through challenges with a creative flair, sculpting digital solutions that not only meet functional requirements but also elevate the user experience.

PORTFOLIO

Throughout my coding journey, I dove into the creation of "mock websites" to put theoretical understanding into practice and experiment with new techniques. My portfolio showcases examples of these projects. Although they aren't actual live websites, they function as creative templates that could be requested by a business.

Pastas Restaurant website

My very first creation into web development with the creation of a fully responsive restaurant website. Crafted using a combination of HTML, CSS, and JS, this project marks the beginning of my coding journey.

Weather app

First React-based weather app I made offers real-time updates on the current weather and a comprehensive 5-day forecast. Designed to be your go-to source for weather information, this app effortlessly incorporates the powerful OpenWeather API, ensuring a compelling and immersive user experience.

Notes app

This intuitive app empowers users to create personal notes and add them to a dynamic list, providing an effective way to organize thoughts and ideas. I took the chance to integrate Sass for the first time, applying the skills I've recently acquired.
